intro: Liparia myrtifolia, commonly known as the myrtle-leaved liparia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Liparia myrtifolia is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
